author: accelerate2030
title: Cardano for African impact ventures
description: Lack of in-depth knowledge of exact needs of impact entrepreneurs in Africa, and awareness of how blockchain solutions can be of help

f6_assessments.q0: Accelerate2030 is a very good support network for entrepreneurs with more than 16000 members. Currently, Accelerate2030 is well supported in more than 10 countries in Africa. Cardano for African impact ventures is a good proposal to combine Accelerate2030 with Cardano ecosystem to open up a new development opportunity for members of this system in more than 10 African countries in particular and more 33 countries worldwide in general. The successful proposal will add an extremely great channel to help entrepreneurs understand the blockchain system and how Cardano ecosystem can be applied to their businesses thereby attracting entrepreneurs to the business. Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: With more than 10 years of experience in the field of innovation and entrepreneurship, having organized many seminars to help the business community, I believe that Ljupka Mitrinovska and Accelerate 2030 members will successfully complete the proposal. this. I think, you also need to pay more attention to some issues that will lead to the proposal not being successful as expected, besides the fact that Accelerate2030 members are not interested in the survey, they don't know about it. information or they are not interested in this proposal is also a problem you need to solve. I believe, when you come up with the solutions of these problems in more detail, the community will be more convincing.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap from May to August you give is very complete and detailed. This shows that you have prepared very well for this proposal. However, there is one issue that you need to be more transparent about in the use of the $20,000 after receiving the funding. For example, $5000 for survey design, launch and analysis, how would you spend it? The organization selects and supports (up to) 5 companies to integrate Cardano into their business and develop use cases: $10,000 Need to be more specific on how this money will be used. You also need to be more specific about KPIs so that they can be easily measured in terms of numbers. Example: How many companies are trained in blockchain and Cardano? How many entrepreneurs will use Cardano in their business? I believe that if you can do this, the community will appreciate you more.

f6_assessments.q0: The  core aim of the 'Grow Africa' initiative is to increase Cardano awareness and understanding on the African continent. The purpose of this proposal is to produce intro workshops and build tangible use-cases to enhance Cardano adoption in Africa by providing an unequaled chance to raise awareness of Cardano in Africa through the worldwide Impact Hub Network and its flagship initiative, Accelerate2030. This will aid in the development and acceptance of the Cardano blockchain throughout Africa, helping to achieve the aim of making Cardano the block chain of choice in Africa by 2023. This proposal presents a Cardano technology use-case solution in detail. This proposal adequately addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer demonstrates that he or she has the necessary abilities and expertise to carry out the project. The proposer is aware of the type and quantity of team members needed to carry out the plan, as well as a budget that is broken down and acceptable in order to meet the objectives. The plan includes a realistic timeframe for completing the task, problems and dangers that may arise during implementation, as well as potential solutions.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal gives sufficient information that will audit the progress and the success of the proposal as its elaborates the processes of implementation and the metrics of success measurement as well as the key performance indicators

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is an amazing effort that aims to boost Cardano awareness in Africa through the well-established global impact hub Accelerate2030. It aims to have an impact on African entrepreneurs, share information about blockchain technology, and help increase Cardano adoption in Africa. The proposal has the potential to make a huge impact on the Catalyst community and the Cardano ecosystem by stimulating development in Africa. As a result, it converses with the challenge's goal. Many Africans, particularly entrepreneurs, are unaware of Cardano and blockchain technology, and to be honest, this project will have an impact on entrepreneurs in Africa and beyond across the innovation ecosystems.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team's qualifications have been provided, and their organization/program website indicates that they have extensive experience connecting entrepreneurs and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The team appears to be well-qualified to oversee the project, and there is a strong possibility that it will be executed flawlessly.
The team has also detailed on how they want to accomplish this, and their targets appear to be achievable. The budget is clearly allocated and reasonable in order to implement the concrete measures outlined in a detailed roadmap. The team has also identified a potential challenge or risk in successfully completing this project and has developed a solution to address this issue. I am optimistic about the Accelerate2030 team, and their goals appear to be highly attainable. I am confident that this project will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The information presented and the KPIs mentioned in the proposal are sufficient to fully audit the project's progress and success from its inception to its integration. The specified milestones are also suitable for assessing progress. As a result, the chances of achieving this goal in blockchain technologies and the entire Cardano ecosystem are high. Nevertheless, the acceptance rate of the blockchain and Cardano will be a little challenging since most entrepreneurs in Africa have little or no knowledge about blockchain technology, and this will be an opportunity to increase awareness by educating entrepreneurs, promoting sustainable economic growth, and creating productive and decent employment opportunities for upcoming entrepreneurs and for all.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal duly meet that which the challenge asks for as it intend to identify the gap in Africa entrepreneurship and aims at providing a better understanding impact entrepreneurs needs across the African continent, share information on blockchain technology, and develop solutions on the cardano blockchain based on identified needs.
The proposal addresses a number of problems as its seeks to organize some workshops and sensitization to develop concrete use cases to increase adoption of cardano in Africa and accelerate 2030 global program aiming at supporting entrepreneurs from developing markets which was lunched in 2016 by impact Hub and UNDP from Geneva, implemented in 33 countries supporting nearly 500 entrepreneurs.  
The proposer identifies the lack of in depth knowledge of impact entrepreneurs in Africa as a challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has given detail time parameters of which the project is to be implemented, key performance indicators has been outlined.
There is detailed budget breakdown which is self explanatory.
The team members skills and experience is vast enough to implement the project successfully.
The team has identify a lot of challenges that may delay the speed implementation of the project, notwithstanding of the challenges, the team has provided possible solutions to deal with the issues by organizing blockchain and cardano workshops and sensitization programs.
f6_assessments.q2:
specific locations where the project could be implemented and blockchain technology and cardano introduce to the local entrepreneurs is provided for verifiability.
Relevant websites, youtube channels and links are given where progress of work can be tracked.
The team also outlined metrics that will be used to measure their level of success.

f6_assessments.q0: The described problem in this proposal aligns with the challenge. Blockchain needs are very critical and need to be addressed as soon as possible, this proposal offers a platform where concrete use cases are developed to increase adoption of Cardano in Africa for the blockchain needs of entrepreneurs is one that helps in seeding and growing Cardano blockchain in Africa. This is not just a win for Africa but Cardano as a whole would benefit from this project. The proposal has the potential of reaching out to many entrepreneurs in the long term, for me it’s very good.
f6_assessments.q1: The relevant experience provided and the information about the team gives me the assurance that the team is well equipped to deliver the task. The budget is well presented however, there could be more breakdown in the budget. The individual amounts of design, launch and analysis survey could have been provided. Yet still, the budget is reasonable to achieve the set goals. There is a detailed plan and clear timeline for the project’s implementation. A challenge or risk has been identified, and that for me is a good effort.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap presented is detailed with clear milestones and time horizon. Educating a significant number of entrepreneurs is one of the desired outcome of the proposal and that for me is a good picture of what success looks like. The metrics/KPIs stated here I believe were well chosen as they help to evaluate the success of the proposal. Also, I can see a clarity in the targeted problem described and the solution. I believe the proposed solution is effective to address the problem m.

solution: Research impact entrepreneurs blockchain needs, offer intro workshops & develop concrete use-cases to increase adoption of Cardano in Africa
experience: Accelerate2030 is a global program supporting entrepreneurs from developing & emerging markets to scale their solutions for the Sustainable Development Goals. Launched in 2016 by Impact Hub & UNDP from Geneva, implemented across 33 countries, supporting nearly 500 entrepreneurs
